seo.title: Phonetic Name Matching API | Intelligent KYC & Verification
seo.description: Enhance identity verification with Decentro’s Phonetic Name Matching API. Resolve spelling variations, typos, and cultural nuances for seamless KYC and onboarding.
seo.ogTitle: Phonetic Name Matching API | Intelligent KYC & Verification

productBanner.heading: Phonetic Name Matching API
productBanner.tagline: Intelligent Identity Verification Beyond Exact Matches
productBanner.altText: Phonetic Name Matching API for KYC

inlineImageAndParagraph.text:
Phonetic Name Matching is a critical component of Decentro's Farsight Data Forensics suite. Unlike simple string comparison, this API utilizes advanced phonetic algorithms to match names based on pronunciation and linguistic patterns. It overcomes challenges such as spelling variations, typos, and transliteration differences common in diverse markets like India.

Designed for high-stakes KYC and onboarding workflows, it ensures that legitimate customers are verified instantly—even if their name is spelled differently across ID documents and bank records—while flagging inconsistencies that indicate potential fraud.

inlineImageAndParagraph2.text: Decentro's Text Similarity and Name Matching capabilities go beyond basic fuzzy logic. By leveraging intelligent pattern recognition, the system provides a confidence score that reflects the true likelihood of a match, handling complex edge cases in identity verification.

subheadings.title: The engine operates on three core verification pillars:
Phonetic Intelligence
bulletPoints: Identifies sound-alike variations and handles cultural name differences (e.g., 'Smyth' vs 'Smith' or regional transliterations) to prevent false negatives.

subheadings.title: Fuzzy Logic & Typos
bulletPoints: Accounts for inadvertent data entry errors, character swaps, and missing middle names, ensuring a seamless user experience during onboarding.

subheadings.title: Configurable Precision
bulletPoints: Allows businesses to set custom similarity thresholds, balancing the need for strict security with high conversion rates.

items.title: Input Normalization
items.description: The API accepts name inputs from disparate sources (e.g., OCR output vs. User Input) and normalizes formats for processing.

items.title: Algorithmic Matching
items.description: Proprietary algorithms analyze phonetic components and character sequences to determine linguistic similarity.

items.title: Similarity Scoring
items.description: Returns a precise match percentage, allowing your logic to approve, flag, or reject identities based on your risk appetite.
Securely accept text data via the `Match Enginepost` endpoint, supporting various formats from ID cards or user forms.
Apply sound-based algorithms to bridge the gap between spelling differences and actual pronunciation.
Deliver a real-time similarity score, enabling automated decision-making for KYC and fraud prevention.

data.text: Accelerate customer acquisition by verifying identities instantly, even with inconsistent data entry.
Meet strict KYC and AML requirements by accurately verifying customer names against watchlists and ID proofs.
Cleanse your CRM and user databases by identifying and merging duplicate records caused by name variations.
Identify suspicious patterns where names are slightly altered to evade detection systems.
Verify beneficiary names in real-time before processing high-value transactions to prevent misdirection.

subBanner.text: Decentro’s matching engine processes requests in real-time, delivering high-confidence results that allow you to automate approvals and focus manual review only where it's needed.

frequentlyAskedQuestions.query: How does Phonetic Name Matching differ from exact matching?
frequentlyAskedQuestions.solution: Exact matching requires strings to be identical (e.g., 'Amit' != 'Ameet'). Phonetic matching uses algorithms to understand that these names sound the same, returning a high match score despite spelling differences.

frequentlyAskedQuestions.query: Can the API handle Indian names and transliteration?
frequentlyAskedQuestions.solution: Yes, Decentro’s API is specifically optimized for Indian contexts, effectively handling variations in spelling that occur when names are transliterated from regional languages to English.
Absolutely. The API is designed for synchronous processing, delivering match results and confidence scores instantly to support live onboarding flows.

frequentlyAskedQuestions.query: Do I need a Sandbox account to test this?
frequentlyAskedQuestions.solution: Yes, you can access the API credentials via the Decentro dashboard and test integration in our Sandbox environment (`in.staging.decentro.tech`) before going live.

list.text: Relying on exact string equality or basic Levenshtein distance.
